text: Zophar’s Second Speech
Then\f + \fr 20:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Zophar the Naamathite answered and said,
“Therefore my disquieting thoughts bring me back
⸤for the sake of⸥\f + \fr 20:2 \ft Literally “and in because of” \f* my inward excitement.\f + \fr 20:2 \ft Or “my inward haste” \f*
I hear discipline that insults me,
and a spirit beyond my understanding answers me.
“Did you\f + \fr 20:4 \ft Singular \f* know this from of old,
since the setting of \add the\add* human being on earth,
that \add the\add* rejoicing of \add the\add* wicked \add is\add* ⸤short⸥,\f + \fr 20:5 \ft Literally “from near” \f*
and the joy of \add the\add* godless ⸤lasts only a moment⸥?\f + \fr 20:5 \ft Literally “\fq is \ft until a moment” \f*
Even though his stature mounts up to the heaven,
and his head reaches to the clouds,
he will perish forever like his dung;
\add those who\add* have seen him will say, ‘Where \add is\add* he?’
He will fly away like a dream, and they will not find him,
and he will be chased away like a vision of \add the\add* night.
\add The\add* eye \add that\add* saw him ⸤will not see him again⸥,\f + \fr 20:9 \ft Literally “and it will not do again” \f*
and his place will no longer behold him.
His children will seek favors from \add the\add* poor,
and his hands will return his wealth.
His bones were full of his vigor,
but\f + \fr 20:11 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* it will lie down with him on\f + \fr 20:11 \ft Or “in” \f* \add the\add* dust.
“Though wickedness tastes sweet in his mouth,
\add and\add* he hides it under his tongue,
\add though\add* he spares it and does not let it go
\add and\add* holds it back in the midst of his palate,
in his bowels his food is turned,
\add the\add* venom of horned vipers \add is\add* ⸤within him⸥.\f + \fr 20:14 \ft Literally “in his entrails” \f*
He swallows riches, but\f + \fr 20:15 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he vomits them\f + \fr 20:15 \ft Hebrew “it” \f* \add up\add*;
God drives them\f + \fr 20:15 \ft Hebrew “it” \f* out from his stomach.
He will suck \add the\add* poison of horned vipers;
\add the\add* viper’s tongue will kill him.
⸤He will not enjoy the streams⸥,\f + \fr 20:17 \ft Literally “He will not look on streams” \f*
\add the\add* torrents of honey and curds.
Returning \add the\add* products of \add his\add* toil, he will not swallow;\f + \fr 20:18 \ft Hebrew “and he will not swallow” \f*
according to the profit of his trade, ⸤he will not enjoy⸥,\f + \fr 20:18 \ft Literally “and he will not taste” \f*
for he has oppressed; he has abandoned \add the\add* poor;
he has seized a house but\f + \fr 20:19 \ft Or “and” \f* did not build it.
Because he has not known satisfaction in his stomach,
⸤he lets nothing escape that he desires⸥.\f + \fr 20:20 \ft Literally “in his desire he does not let be saved” \f*
⸤There is nothing left after he has eaten⸥;\f + \fr 20:21 \ft Literally “There is not a remnant at his eating” \f*
therefore his prosperity will not endure.
In the fullness of his excess ⸤he will be in distress⸥;\f + \fr 20:22 \ft Literally “it will be in distress for him” \f*
all of misery’s power will come \add upon\add* him.

⸤When his stomach fills up⸥,\f + \fr 20:23 \ft Literally “It will be to fill up his stomach” \f* \add God\add* will send ⸤his burning anger⸥\f + \fr 20:23 \ft Literally “the blaze of his nose/anger” \f* upon him,
and he will let \add it\add* rain down upon him\f + \fr 20:23 \ft Or “them” \f* as his food.
“He will flee from an iron weapon,
\add but\add* an arrow of bronze will pierce him.
He draws \add it\add* forth, and it comes out from \add his\add* body,
and \add the\add* glittering point comes from his gall-bladder;
terrors come upon him.
⸤Total darkness⸥\f + \fr 20:26 \ft Literally “All darkness” \f* is hidden for his treasures;\f + \fr 20:26 \ft Or “His treasures are hidden \fq by \ft total darkness” \f*
⸤an unfanned fire⸥\f + \fr 20:26 \ft Literally “a fire not fanned” \f* will devour him;
\add the\add* remnant\f + \fr 20:26 \ft Of his treasures \f* ⸤will be consumed⸥\f + \fr 20:26 \ft Literally “will be evil,” or “will be bad” \f* in his tent.
\add The\add* heavens will reveal his guilt,
and \add the\add* earth will rise up against him.
The products of his house will be carried away\f + \fr 20:28 \ft Or “the produce of his house will go away into exile” \f*
\add like\add* gushing waters\f + \fr 20:28 \ft Or “\fq by \ft gushing waters” \f* on the day of his wrath.
This \add is\add* a wicked human being’s portion from God
and the inheritance of his decree from God.”\f + \fr 20:29 \ft Or “and the inheritance decreed for him by God” (compare ESV, NJPS) \f*
